Students and Families, as we move closer to the start of school, there are a few items we feel every student should add to the school supply list. Please know, the school will also have the following items, but we feel each student should have them as well for their desk or locker. We also know some of them are hard to find, so we wanted to give you ample time.

The items are:

Hand Sanitizer
Clorox Wipes
Masks- masks for elementary students are difficult to find, and while the state plan does not call for them in the classrooms, it does call for them in halls and on buses. We will have disposable masks available, but so far we have only found them in adult sizes.

Also, if you are interested in School at Home as an option, please call or email your principal as we will be accommodating this request as well. We want all of our students to feel safe either at school or at home.

Todd Reynolds- treynolds@wpcschools.org
Shelly McBride- smcbride@wpcschools.org

Please know, the school will also have the following items, but we feel each student should have them as well for their desk or locker. We also know some of them are hard to find, so we wanted to give you ample time.

The items are:

Hand Sanitizer
Clorox Wipes
Masks- masks for elementary students are difficult to find, and while the state plan does not call for them in the classrooms, it does call for them in halls and on buses. We will have disposable masks available, but so far we have only found them in adult sizes.

Also, if you are interested in School at Home as an option, please call or email your principal as we will be accommodating this request as well. We want all of our students to feel safe either at school or at home.

Todd Reynolds- treynolds@wpcschools.org
Shelly McBride- smcbride@wpcschools.org

The Michigan Department of Health and Human Services recently announced a new program: Pandemic EBT.

The Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer Program (P-EBT) program provides temporary funding to address emergency food needs for families affected by the COVID-19 pandemic.

P-EBT food assistance benefits will go to Michigan families with students ages 5-18 that are eligible for free or reduced-price school meals. This includes families currently receiving Food Assistance Program benefits, as well as those not currently enrolled in the program. No application is necessary for eligible families to receive P-EBT benefits.

Please see flyer below for more details on the program.

Full press release: https://www.michigan.gov/coronavirus/0,9753,7-406-98158-525248--,00.html

WPCS Families,

Today the Governor of Michigan issued an unprecedented Executive Order, one that will cause us to think, work and live very differently than we are used to. This health crisis is unlike anything we have experienced, but together we will get through this tough time.

The Executive Order stated these key points-

* Face to face learning for the 2019-20 school year has ended
* Requires WPCS to provide education for all our students
* Requires our plan to be approved by both the ISD and the SOM
* Gives WPCS flexibility in delivering the education

Please be patient as we work with our teachers and administrators to develop lessons and plans for our children. Please continue to watch the website and Facebook for additional information.

Next week we will continue to offer lunches to our students, as we will for the remainder of the school year.

If you have questions or concerns, please email your teacher or building principal, as the offices are closed during the pandemic.

Please keep you and your family safe and healthy.

Sincerely,

Jon Keyer and Carrie Erlandson
